Title: June 2017
Content: 16*p48418a01628* do not write in this area do not write in this area do not write in this area5 poliomyelitis (polio) is a disease of the central nervous system.  it is an infectious disease caused by a poliovirus. there are three pathogenic strains of poliovirus.  these strains have different antigens. the poliovirus is a single-stranded rna virus. the diagram below shows some steps involved in the replication of a poliovirus. poliovirus rnatemplate rnaproteinsynthesissynthesissynthesis  *(a) explain how protein and copies of the poliovirus rna are synthesised from the poliovirus rna.(6)
